subject: Where can I get the Old Jerome font used in the Lord's Prayer?
msgSnippet: I m new to Quikscript. Just came across it a few days ago, and am still getting familiar with the shapes of the letters, and the correspondences between
messageBody:
I'm new to Quikscript. Just came across it a few days ago, and am
still getting familiar with the shapes of the letters, and the
correspondences between Quikscript and the keyboard. However, I've
been able to download the King Plus font and have been practicing
typing and already getting used to touch-typing Quikscript, though I'm
predictably and understandably very very slow indeed.

I use Quikscript in my diary, and for confidential notes to myself in
my personal files.

While going through material in the FILES section of this group, I
came across the Lord's Prayer, and fell in love with the font. I
noticed that it is based on the year 2000 version of the Jerome font.

Two questions:

(1) Was Jerome a font designer? What other fonts did he come up with?

(2) Where can I download Jerome 2000? I looked around in the group
links, but if it's there I missed it.
